result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Antione McKinney

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Leon Antione McKinney. Defendant Leon Antione McKinney in court, in custody. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi states DE is still on a PO Hold unknown if DE will be revoked yet or not. Atty Dolfi states case will most likely be appointed to Atty Schmidt sometime next week. Court sets PH with Court commissioner. Adjourned 02:10 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report
The original history event date is: 10-18-2022

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 48 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:39 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Leon Antione McKinney in court, in custody. Includes 22CF721 INIT and 22CM487 RW. 22CF721: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. 22CM487: Atty Dolfi notes DE was in Custody in MN due to extradition. Court quashed warrant. bond reinstated. DE is on a PO Hold. Court sets PSC in branch 4. Adjourned 01:48 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
